result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Marie Crocker

defendant.name: Crocker, Melissa Marie
defendant.address: 122 West Johnson Street, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt:
3:32 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker appeared by video.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Melissa Marie Crocker.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Set for PLEAS. Court reviews file and notes there may be a new complaint filed.  ADA Becker states there may be a resolution without filing a new complaint. DE to appear in person for next court date. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 3:35 PM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
for DE to appear via zoom on 11/1. Filed by Atty Harrelson. arc   to rg
Filed by DA. kma

AMENDED

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

11:03  AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Melissa Marie Crocker.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court also calls 22CF616- Michael Kirland in court in custody,  Atty Phillip Helgeson for DE in court.   Atty Satorius states DE is willing to waive PH and believes Mr. Kirland is also planning to waive PH.  As to 22CF615- Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Satorius states they would like to continue with ARGN.  ADA Ellenwood states the information will mirror complaint. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all 5 counts.  State to provide all discovery within the next 20 days, motions to be filed 20 days after that. Atty Satorius believes this matter will be resolved soon, asking to schedule PLEAS. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Tina Sitz from JSC is here, states DE has not done any testing at this time.  Atty Satorius makes statements in regards to this.  Court orders DE to test today before leaving today.  Court modifies bond. Adjourned at 11:15 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED. kma   ro rg
to reschedule PH 09/26/22. Filed by SPD. arc   to rg
Filed by Atty Satorius. arc   e: DA
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: DE appeared by zoom, Clerk saw phone number on zoom and talked with DE.  DE understands she is to appear in person for next court date, gave her time and date. bph

1:42 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker not in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius not in court.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin with Officer Hemker. Set for PH.  Atty Satorius is in intake.  Court reviews file and notes DE did call stating she didn't have a way to get here for this hearing. ADA Becker requests to schedule another PH with 22CF616 as it's the same officer and same arrest. Court authorizes warrant- STAYED until  9/29/22 at 10:45, if DE doesn't appear court will issue warrant.  Tina Sitz from JSC makes statements regarding missed testing.  Adjourned at 1:47 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.
filed by PD's office, appointing Atty Satorius. bph

DE called at 11:00AM stating she did not have a way to get to court today and requested to appear via Zoom. Clerk requested DE fax in a request; DE stated she did not have access to a fax machine. Transferred call to JA. srb

AMENDED

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

2:02 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file and notes DE does qualify for PD but no PD here. Bond argument. Court questions DE.  Court reviews Pierce Co Case. DE states she does have reliable transportation. Court modifies bond.  DE confirms address on file is a good mailing address.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:22 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Rockow appeared.  Stephanie Schmidt with Intern Lanie Krause appeared for Defendant for today. Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker in court, in custody. Defendant qualifies for PD. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.
